title: Neue Haas Unica...
content:
Oh boy, this must be what hrant has been waiting for... (or isn't it?)

[http://www.linotype.com/1300977/NeueHaasUnica-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414165923/http:/www.linotype.com/1300977/NeueHaasUnica-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/1300977/NeueHaasUnica-family.html")

apparently the rest of the family is yet to follow
author: Queneau

comments.content:
Yes, delighted! To me it redeems the grot genre of type.

I just hope the textier weights come out soon...

hhp

Toshi is doing awesome work on it.  
Last week at Nancy, we were talking about the different ways to handle masters and instances on Superpolator vs Glyphs, and he showed me a quick preview of the Unica masters setup in Glyphs. They look really really good!

[It is released now](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414165923/http:/www.linotype.com/1492949/NeueHaasUnicaProCFFCompleteFamilyPack-valuepack.html), hrant. And at the moment a license for the whole family costs € 117.81 incl. VAT.

Great news. In fact we have two now!  
 [http://lineto.com/Lineto.com/Frontpages/2015/23+Feb+2015/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414165923/http:/lineto.com/Lineto.com/Frontpages/2015/23+Feb+2015/ "http://lineto.com/Lineto.com/Frontpages/2015/23+Feb+2015/")

hhp

I haven't done any direct comparisons myself yet, but from what I've seen of others the biggest difference is spacing, with the Lineto version being much tighter, hence more suitable for display use. Other differences: the Monotype version is more strictly monoline, and nicely covers Cyrillic and Greek.

hhp

"the Lineto version being much tighter" than?  
I believe the Lineto spacing is the same as in Scangraphic Body version.

I was saying Lineto's is tighter than Monotype's, but apparently it's tighter than Scangraphic's Body too: [https://twitter.com/dominicphilcox/status/585530619192598529](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414165923/https:/twitter.com/dominicphilcox/status/585530619192598529 "https://twitter.com/dominicphilcox/status/585530619192598529")

hhp

OK, thanks.
